title: Taiwan Election Shapes Up With Tsai’s Party Set to Tap Candidate
description: Lai Ching-te’s mother was bitterly disappointed when the Harvard-educated doctor told her in the 1990s that he was giving up his medical career to enter politics.

title: Sunak Hires Former Morgan Stanley Executive as Business Adviser
description: Rishi Sunak has hired a top former Morgan Stanley executive as his new business adviser, as the UK premier seeks to spur economic growth ahead of an expected election next autumn.

title: US Is Taking Classified Documents Leak Very Seriously, Defense Secretary Says
description: The US takes the leak of classified documents “very seriously” and will do whatever is necessary to keep the country secure, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin said in his first public comments about a trove of top secret documents that surfaced online in recent weeks.

title: Manhattan DA Bragg Sues Jim Jordan Over House GOP’s Trump Case Probe
description: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg sued to block US Representative Jim Jordan’s investigation of his prosecution of former President Donald Trump, calling it a “brazen and unconstitutional attack” on the case.

title: At Least Seven Killed in Fresh Azerbaijan-Armenia Border Clash
description: At least seven troops were killed in renewed fighting between Azerbaijan and Armenia on Tuesday in the deadliest clash between the former Soviet republics this year.

title: Fox Election-Conspiracy Theories Spur Deluge of Threats, Dominion Voting Says
description: Dominion Voting Systems is “under siege” from threats spawned by 2020 election-conspiracy theories propounded by Fox News TV hosts and guests, a lawyer for Dominion told a judge.

title: Biden Climate Czar Says GOP Forcing US to Clean-Energy Sidelines
description: The White House’s climate czar slammed Republican efforts to repeal portions of its signature climate law, as President Joe Biden prepares to make the historic measure central to his expected reelection bid.

title: On the US and China, Macron Says the Quiet Part Out Loud
description: Complaints about Europe’s status as “vassal” of the US should register in Washington.

title: Jersey City Mayor Fulop Plans Run to Succeed Murphy as NJ Governor
description: Steven Fulop, the three-term Democratic mayor of Jersey City, entered the race on Tuesday to succeed Governor Phil Murphy in 2025.

title: Chicago Lands 2024 Democratic Convention
description: Democrats will hold their 2024 national convention in Chicago, a decision that highlights the growing influence of Illinois Governor J.B. Pritzker and recent progressive wins in the Midwest.

title: Lula Struggles to Build Base in Congress 100 Days Into His Term
description: One hundred days into his presidency, Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is still struggling to build a reliable base of congressional support he needs to steer key proposals through the country’s legislature.

title: Trump Aide Stephen Miller Appears Before Washington Grand Jury
description: Stephen Miller, a top White House aide to former President Donald Trump, appeared before a federal grand jury in Washington on Tuesday.

title: Protests Rock Ethiopia After Decision to Disband Regional Forces
description: Protests erupted across Ethiopia’s second-largest state over a plan by Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed’s administration to disband regional special forces and merge them with the national army.

title: Congress Gets Access to Trump, Biden Classified Documents
description: A bipartisan group of senior lawmakers has begun receiving classified documents recovered from properties belonging to former President Donald Trump and President Joe Biden, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: IMF Trims World Growth Outlook as Financial Risks Raise Pressure
description: The International Monetary Fund trimmed its global-growth projections, warning of high uncertainty and risks as financial-sector stress adds to pressures emanating from tighter monetary policy and Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Japan Defense Ministry to Procure Missiles From Mitsubishi Heavy
description: The Japanese Defense Ministry has signed four missile-development and procurement contracts with the country’s biggest defense firm, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries.

title: Economic Pain Intensifies in Kenya as Workers’ Salaries Delayed
description: Kenya failed to pay civil servants’ March salaries on time, a delay that signals a liquidity strain for a government facing unprecedented financial obligations.

title: Federal Home Loan Banks Get Backing From Advisers to Biden as Criticism Mounts
description: Two housing-policy experts whose previous recommendations have been closely followed by the Biden administration are defending the Federal Home Loan Banks, raising the stakes in a debate over whether a major overhaul is needed.

title: Malaysia Lists Sulu Heir as a Terrorist in Claim Over Sabah
description: Malaysia has classified one of the self-styled descendants of the sultanate of Sulu as a terrorist, as part of measures to safeguard national sovereignty amid a territorial dispute between the two parties.

title: Romania Plans to Buy F-35 Fighter Jets to Bolster Air Defense
description: Romania plans to purchase F-35 fighter jets to boost air defense capabilities in response to rising security threats in the region from Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: UK Appoints MI5 Deputy As First Woman Cyber Spy Chief
description: The UK appointed Anne Keast-Butler as the first female head of its cyber-spying agency GCHQ.

title: Russia’s Diving Oil Exports Suggest Output Cut Beginning to Bite
description: Crude flows saw their biggest weekly drop since December

title: Israel Generals Give a Stark Warning: Its Enemies Smell Blood
description: Israel’s Passover holiday week has been a deadly one filled with rocket barrages, enemy drones, drive-by shootings and a car-ramming, prompting a deeply divided society to agree on one thing: its enemies smell blood.

title: US-UK Special Relationship Isn’t So Special
description: For more than a century, the UK has enjoyed a central role in the US’s relationship with Europe. Joe Biden’s visit to Ireland this week will show how far London has fallen down Washington’s agenda.

title: Swiss President Defends UBS-Credit Suisse Deal in Parliament Showdown
description: Karin Keller-Sutter, Switzerland's finance minister, left, and Alain Berset, Switzerland's president, during a news conference in Bern, Switzerland, on Sunday, March 19, 2023. UBS Group AG agreed to buy Credit Suisse Group AG in a historic, government-brokered deal aimed at containing a crisis of confidence that threatened to spread across global financial markets. Photographer: Pascal Mora/Bloomberg

title: Hungary’s Top Diplomat Visits Moscow in Defiance of EU Stance
description: Hungary’s top diplomat flew to Moscow for talks on energy, a rare visit by a European Union country that underscores Budapest’s schism with the rest of the bloc over Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Le Maire Says EU Must Not Be Pushed Around in US-China Rivalry
description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said Europe mustn’t be pushed around due to the rivalry between the US and China, standing by President Emmanuel Macron’s comment that the bloc’s countries shouldn’t become vassals in a global crisis.

title: Ukraine Latest: US Vice President to Meet With Polish Premier
description: US Vice President Kamala Harris will meet with Polish Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki on Tuesday to discuss Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: AI ‘Trustworthiness’ Is Focal Point of New US Government Inquiry
description: A US Commerce Department agency is opening an inquiry into how companies and regulators can ensure that artificial intelligence systems are trustworthy, legal and ethical.

title: Biden to Retrace Roots in Celebratory Irish Tour Ahead of 2024
description: Joe Biden is many things. And some days, above all, he’s Irish.

title: Swiss Government Set for Grilling Over UBS-Credit Suisse Deal
description: Less than a month after forcing through the creation of a Swiss banking juggernaut, the country’s government is set to be grilled in parliament this week.

title: Biden Faces Awkward Talks Abroad as US Reels from Intelligency Breach
description: It may prove to be the most serious intelligence leak the US has had in a decade, and behind closed doors, it has set off uncomfortable conversations with the nation’s closest allies.

title: Macron Takes Pitch for EU Power to The Hague as Backlash Builds
description: Emmanuel Macron’s latest attempt to cast the European Union as a balancing power between the US and China will be tested this week as he seeks to enlist support from the Netherlands.

title: China Says Homegrown mRNA Covid Shot is a Preferred Booster
description: China said its recently-approved first homegrown mRNA Covid vaccine was one of its two preferred boosters, potentially encouraging more people to get their follow-up shots amid a renewed government campaign to shore up immunity.

title: Japan Underscores Concern About China Military Activity in Talks
description: Japan expressed deep concern about increased Chinese military activity around its shores, including in coordination with Russia, at a bilateral meeting of senior officials from Beijing and Tokyo on oceanic matters.

title: Kim Seeks to Boost War Defenses, Cuts Hotline with South Korea
description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un called for “practical and offensive” war capabilities as his state issued a fresh warning to the US and cut communications links with South Korea used to reduce tensions on their heavily armed border.
